document.heading: Office of Motion Picture and Television Development Establishment Act of 2014

history.narrative: Law 20-268, the “Office of Motion Picture and Television Development Establishment Act of 2014,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 20-891. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on December 2, 2014, and December 17, 2014, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on January 25, 2015, it was assigned Act No. 20-607 and transmitted to Congress for its review. D.C. Law 20-268 became effective May 2, 2015.

section.heading: Establishment of the Office of Motion Picture and Television Development.

annoGroup.heading: Emergency Legislation
annoGroup.annotation: For temporary (90 days) repeal of D.C. Law 20-268, see § 2073 of the Fiscal Year 2016 Budget Support Emergency Act of 2015 (D.C. Act 21-127, July 27, 2015, 62 DCR 10201).

annoGroup.heading: Emergency Legislation
